caption:
This photograph features a young man standing outdoors next to a car with its trunk open. He is dressed casually in a grey, short-sleeved button-up shirt with rolled-up sleeves, blue jeans, and a baseball cap. He has curly hair and is smiling at the camera, giving a cheerful expression.

The young man is holding a large, round, metal container filled with crab meat. He appears to be in the process of handling the seafood, possibly either preparing it for cooking or sorting it after a catch. His hands are both in the container as if he's either placing or arranging the crabs.

In the background, there is a white building and a yellow barrel, suggesting an industrial or a casual outdoor setting, perhaps near a dock or a place where fresh seafood is processed or sold. The environment feels sunny and busy, typical of a working area related to seafood procurement or preparation.
title: In the spring of 1973, the Mississippi River reached its highest level in more than 150 years. Unprecedented flooding occurred throughout the river basin. Particularly affected were the marsh areas below New Orleans and the entire Atchafalaya River Basin. Catfish buyer in Allemands off-loading fish from truck. Three weeks earlier, this area was in danger of flooding.
